content: I am a master of applied science (MASc) student at the mechanical and industrial engineering department of the University of Toronto. I am currently working on transfer learning in reinforcement learning with dynamic mismatch under the supervision of Professor Chi-Guhn Lee. My research interests mainly focus on sequential decision-making problems formulated in the reinforcement learning framework.
summary: I am a master of applied science (MASc) student at the mechanical and industrial engineering department of the University of Toronto. I am currently working on transfer learning in reinforcement learning with dynamic mismatch under the supervision of Professor Chi-Guhn Lee.
title: Matin Moezzi
Applying Deep Reinforcment Learning to Solve Control Problems Described by a System of Delay Differential Equations (DDEs)

summary: Studying reinforcement learning (RL) methods namely, inverse RL and handcrafted rule-based modules to address the safety assurance problem in autonomous driving
title: Deep Reinforcement Learning Methods for Safety Assurance in Autonomous Driving
Solving the System of ODEs of the Control Spread of Ebola Virus Epidemic using Deep Neural Networks

summary: Studied online multi-label classification methods in a semi-supervised setting that are robust to evolving the label space and real-time domains.
title: Online Semi-Supervised Multi-label Classification

summary: Employing uncertainty sets yielded by the conformal regularization algorithm in the uncertainty-aware pseudo-label selection framework to fix the poor calibration neural networks, reducing noisy training data.
title: An Uncertainty-Aware Pseudo-Label Selection Framework using Regularized Conformal Prediction

summary: Developed an approach to improve data-efficiency of the hierarchical deep Q network algorithm (h-DQN) using the importance sampling method.
title: Data-Efficient Hierarchical Reinforcement Learning using Importance Sampling

summary: Implementation of semi-gradient TD algorithm with a neural network as the approximator for the Lunar Lander problem @ Reinforcement Learning Specialization by Coursera
title: Lunar Lander Problem with a Deep RL agent

summary:
Deep Q-Network implementation with experience replay and target networks in the Atari Breakout environment using Gym and Tensorflow libraries.

summary: On-policy TD control (SARSA) implementation in Cliff walking example ([Sutton&Barto](https://web.stanford.edu/class/psych209/Readings/SuttonBartoIPRLBook2ndEd.pdf)) using Tensorflow library. @ Practical Reinforcement Learning Course by Coursera
title: Cliff walking using SARSA Algorithm

summary: Deep crossentropy method implementation for continuous state space environments like Cartpole-v0 environment using Gym and Tensorflow libraries. @ Practical Reinforcement Learning Course by Coursera
